thread.title: 11-year-old girl ‘spent final moments saving three-year-old’ before she was killed in horror motorway crash
thread.title_full: 11-year-old girl ‘spent final moments saving three-year-old’ before she was killed in horror motorway crash

author: pharper
title: 11-year-old girl ‘spent final moments saving three-year-old’ before she was killed in horror motorway crash
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments A HEROIC young girl helped her three-year-old cousin to safety from the wreckage of a car just seconds before a lorry smashed into it and killed her. 
Iman Javed’s “last act in the world” was to help fellow passenger Aaima from the wrecked vehicle when it was stranded on a foggy motorway. PA Iman Javed had a very special bond with her young cousin Aaima who suffers from a heart condition PA:Press Association 3 Iman was a rear-seat passenger in a Volkswagen Sharan which was involved in a collision with a Renault Clio on January 23 
The brave 11-year-old was a passenger in her dad Javel’s Volkswagen Sharan which had been in a collision with a Renault Clio on January 23. 
Iman died when a Volvo HGV travelling in the same direction hit the Renault and Volkswagen. 
Her father Javel remains in a critical condition in hospital. 
In a statement, the family said: “Iman had a particularly special bond with her three-year-old cousin Aaima Vasim who suffers from a serious heart condition. 
“Iman’s last act in this world was to help Aaima out of the vehicle to safety. 
“She was a beautiful, caring, fun-loving, inquisitive and sometimes cheeky young girl. 
“She loved baking and cooking and wanted to learn sewing. 
“Iman could play patiently for hours with her younger baby cousins but she could also tell you the impact Brexit had on the pound!” PA The family said ‘Iman enjoyed shopping and was very good at picking out items for birthdays, baby showers or weddings’ RELATED STORIES double tragedy Teen is killed in moped crash just weeks after pal his died in Croydon tram disaster 'EVERYONE LOVED HIM' Tragedy as lad, 25, dies in car crash the day after qualifying to be a personal trainer SCHOOL RUN SMASH Tragedy as boy, 5, killed after being knocked down in a horror crash walking home from school CAR JERK CAUSED A SMASH Driver tried to scare his nagging girlfriend by twitching the wheel — and then crashed on the M1 SUV SMASH One dead and one critical after horror motorway crash 
Her mother Khaldah described her daughter, who wanted to study medicine, as a “blessing from Allah”. 
The family, which also includes Iman’s twin brother Rehan and older siblings Usman, 18, Mariyah, 19, and Sannia, 15, have thanked the emergency services and the Royal Prestonand Wythenshawe hospitals for their care. 
Linda Cotton, headteacher of Norden Community Primary School, said: “We have all suffered a tremendous shock at the death, in such tragic circumstances. 
“Iman was a first class student and such a bright, intelligent girl.” 
Three other passengers in the vehicle, including Aaima, suffered less serious injuries.
